plugins.name: Arc Type
plugins.description:
Main Function: Arc-shaped text generation.

Simple operation, fast execution, scientifically designed parameters.


Operation Instructions:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select a text layer
  3. Click the "Generate" button and wait briefly for arc text creation
  4. Adjust parameters as needed


Parameter Explanation:


Radian: Adjusts the arc curvature (e.g., 360° = full circle, 180° = semicircle)

Radius: Adjusts the arc radius. You can input values or drag near the input box to modify values, offering convenient operation.

Size: Adjusts font size (adds/subtracts from the original size, allows mixed font sizes).

Vertical Flip icon: Adjusts the arc bending direction (inward or outward).

Outset: Adjusts the starting point of the arc (arc orientation).


Features:

  1. Supports mixed fonts, font weights, colors, and font sizes, as well as font strokes.
  2. Allows secondary editing after generating the arc text.
  3. Supports real-time adjustment and preview.
plugins.tagline: Arc-shaped text generation.

plugins.name: Slide Watermark
plugins.description:
A plugin for quickly adding watermarks, which has the following capabilities:

  1. Add text watermarks or image watermarks.
  2. If you don't want the watermarks, click the Remove button to quickly delete all watermarks.
  3. it is able to set common watermark properties: transparency, rotation angle, the distance between watermarks, and the distance between watermarks and the page edges.
  4. For text watermarks, you can select the font, font size, and color.
  5. Support only add watermark to selected slides


If you want to add watermark to your slides before exporting, you can add watermark first, export it and then remove the watermark, it will not change your slides content.


Come and try this plugin! If you have any good suggestions, you are welcome to share your ideas!
plugins.tagline: A Plugin For Quickly Adding Watermarks

plugins.name: JACoB: AI CodeGen Connector
plugins.description: Transform your Figma designs into React components effortlessly with JACoB: CodeGen Connector. This plugin bridges the gap between design and development by enabling a direct connection to your GitHub repositories with the JACoB GitHub bot. plugins.name: Type Tokens
plugins.description:
How to use:


  1. Open the plugin in the playground file
  2. Copy the type token component to your file (do not change the component hierarchy or layer names)
  3. Using an instance of the component apply your type style to the "Example Text".
  4. Run the plugin and the numbers will be automatically populated to all variants of the component on the current page.


Note: Currently it does not work when type style line-heights are set to auto. Also it will intentionally ignore populating "Font Size" on instances that have the word "clamp" written in them.

plugins.name: Datapaw (AI, Google Sheets, JSON, API, String, Currency, Number, Fake Data, and more)
plugins.description:
Generate realistic data exactly how you want it.

All-in-one data generation tools in a single plugin.


Datapaw helps designers populate their contents with meaningful, customizable data. Instead of using generic placeholder text like lorem ipsum, you can generate production-like data that you provide to enhances the realism of your designs.


Rich feature in every data type


📊 JSON

  1. Import content instantly via direct input or URL
  2. Add 🏞️ images and 🎨 color (HEX & RGB) to your layers
  3. Process complex nested JSON content with ease
  4. Navigate JSON data through tree view or directly to the value
  5. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order
  6. Lock unwanted layers for precise generation 🔒


🤖 Artificial Intelligence (AI)

  1. Instantly generate text & content for your Figma designs with AI
  2. Bring Your Own Key (BYOK), full control of your API key 🔑
  3. Supports OpenAI (others coming soon, fully pluggable architecture)
  4. Configure advanced prompts and generation settings 🎛️
  5. Add AI-generated content to text layers, components, and more


🏓 Google Sheets

  1. Import from the URL of Your Google Sheets
  2. All features in JSON can be done for this data type


🌐 API

  1. Seamlessly generate data from public or private APIs!
  2. Support for dynamic path variables, query parameters, you can now integrate API data into your workflows like never before.


📖 Multi Variable Data

  1. Generate customized data and connect it with variables 🎢
  2. Imagine a product card that uses REALISTIC data that you can easily control


💬 String, Number, Percent, Image, Data & Time, Currency

  1. Set your data EXACTLY as you want it, from min and max ranges to currency symbols, prefixes, suffixes, and others
  2. Control content order from random, as entered, or reverse order


💥 Fake Data

  1. Generate dummy data 📈 for full names, phone numbers, addresses, and more
  2. Available for English, Japanese, Indonesian, and Chinese (China) data


✄ - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -


Not only that, there is still more


🔑 Others Features

  1. Privacy First: All configurations saved locally–your data stays yours.
  2. Layer Freedom: Generate for single or multiple layers with just a few clicks.
  3. Easy Backup: Export and import your configurations between devices.


💪 Supported Data Types

  1. AI NEW
  2. JSON NEW
  3. Google Sheets NEW
  4. API NEW
  5. String (for all your text needs)
  6. Number (with flexible formatting)
  7. Percent
  8. Image
  9. Multi Variable (for complex, interconnected data)
  10. Fake Data (realistic, production-like data)
  11. Date & Time
  12. Currency
  13. …and more coming soon!


💎 Simple Pricing

Try it out with 12 free generations per Figma file, or unlock unlimited access with a one-time payment of $10.


🐞 Got ideas or found a bug?

Comment or contact me in Threads. Your feedback helps make this plugin even better for everyone!

plugins.name: Wormhole Tunnels
plugins.description:
Looking for a plugin that can help you generate round tunnels?


Introducing Wormhole Tunnels!


How it works:

  1. Open the Wormhole Tunnels plugin.
  2. Play with these parameters:
  3. Twist/Spiral (Range: 0-360)
  4. Contraction/Expansion (Range: 0-100)
  5. Radial Lines (Range: 5-50)
  6. Concentric Rings (Range: 5-30)
  7. Depth/Stretch (Range: 0-200)
  8. Warp/Distortion (Range: 0-100)
  9. Adjust the stroke width and color, and click on "Generate".
  10. Your pattern is ready!


NO login/signup required!


Feel free to reach out in case of any doubts, bugs or new feature improvements!
plugins.tagline: A plugin that helps you generate wormhole tunnels from any shape!

plugins.name: Tag Filter
plugins.description:
Usage

You can show or hide specific layers in a batch.


How to use

Set “#TAG/{tag name}” as the layer name.


The tags you set will be listed in the plug-in window.


By selecting the tag you want to display, unselected tags will be hidden.



Ex: #TAG/SAMPLE01, #TAG/SAMPLE02, #TAG/SAMPLE03

plugins.name: Old-school Prototyping
plugins.description:
Before Figma, we had an effective method of presenting design mockups to clients. Creating an HTML page and embedding the mockup directly at the center of the page. This method not only allowed us to showcase our designs in a clear and focused manner but also provided a straightforward way for clients to visualize the final product within a web context.


Features:


  • Retro-styled mockup presentation for a classic prototyping experience.


  • Easy replication of horizontal backgrounds with a 1px repeating background image.


  • Downloaded zip file includes a collection of mockup pages(index.html) with links to individual pages.


  • Lightweight and efficient, ensuring smooth integration into modern workflows.


  • Offers a nostalgic yet practical approach to design presentations.


  • A must-have for aficionados of vintage design aesthetics. :)


Here's how you can contribute:

A quick and easy way to show your appreciation for this plugin is by buying me a coffee. This one-time contribution fuels my passion and helps maintain the development of the plugin.


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/lucksy


Happy Prototyping!

accepted.name: Amila Sampath
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Amila. I design & build user interfaces.

plugins.tagline: Simple prototyping tool that setup HTML pages of your designs with background image and color

plugins.name: Generate HEX, JSON and Import Styles to Figma
plugins.description:
Effortlessly convert solid-colored shapes to HEX codes, generate stunning color scales, and import/export styles as JSON for seamless collaboration. Crafted with 💗 from Nepal, it’s designed to make your creative journey smoother and more efficient. Try it today and elevate your Figma experience!


  1. Generate HEX Code: Select the solid colored shapes and hit the button to extract color codes just below the shape.
  2. Extract Colors: Select the solid colored shape and hit the button to display the respective color scale from 50,100,200 to 950, from light to dark. You can input the Scale Name for naming the style as a group
  3. Generate JSON: To generate JSON code in key value pairs, where keys will be the color scales and values will be HEX codes
  4. Import JSON Style: To import the extracted colors to the local style in Figma. Importing JSON directly to Figma local style


Constraints: For correct order of color scales, you have to first arrange the shapes from light to dark in ascending order.


Limitations:

  1. Generating color scales/weights below the HEX Code.


Usecase: Design system/Style guides
plugins.tagline: Generate HEX, JSON and Import Styles to Figma – Your Ultimate Design Workflow Companion!

plugins.name: OK Palette
plugins.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette’s path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.




OK Palette는 GUI 디자인을 위한 토널 팔레트를 만드는 데 있어 디자이너에게 더 많은 통제권을 부여하면서도 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있도록 돕는 플러그인입니다. OK Palette는 지각적 균일 색 공간(Perceptually Uniform Colorspace)인 OKLCH를 활용해 명도(Lightness), 채도(Chroma), 색상(Hue)을 기반으로 한 토널 팔레트를 손쉽게 생성할 수 있게 해줍니다.


기존에 많이 사용되던 HSB, HSL, HSV 등의 색 공간은 RGB에 비해 채도, 명도를 유지한 채 색상을 변경할 수 있다는 이유로 널리 사용되어 왔지만, 이는 사실이 아닙니다. HSB를 예로 들면, HSB(60, 100, 100)인 노란색과 HSB(240, 100, 100)인 파란색은 분명히 100이라는 같은 B(명도) 값을 가지고 있지만, 우리 눈은 답을 알고 있습니다. 노란색이 더 밝습니다.


반면에 OKLCH 색 공간은 지각적 균일 색 공간으로서 같은 L 값을 가진 색은 어떤 색상(H)일지라도 우리 눈으로 보기에도 같은 밝기일 것을 보장합니다. 이는 GUI 디자인에서 매우 중요하고 유용한 특징입니다. 왜냐하면 인간은 색상이나 채도 등 색의 다른 속성보다도 밝기의 차이를 민감하게 인지하고, 이를 바탕으로 중요도를 인식하기 때문입니다.


OKLCH는 이미 모든 브라우저에서 사용할 수 있는 웹 표준입니다만, 아쉽게도 피그마는 아직 OKLCH 색 공간을 기본 기능으로 제공하지 않습니다. 그러나 다행히도 OKLCH 색 공간을 사용할 수 있는 몇몇 플러그인이 존재합니다. 특히 DokoZero의 OkColor는 매우 훌륭한 플러그인으로, 우리가 OK Palette를 만들기 전에는 이 플러그인을 이용해 (일일이 하나하나 계산해야 했지만) 토널 팔레트를 만들었습니다. OKLCH 색 공간을 활용하는 것은 아니지만, Material Design의 Material Theme Builder는 토널 팔레트를 생성해주는 플러그인으로 구글이 독자적으로 개발한 HCT 색 공간을 활용하고 있으며, 이 또한 지각적 균일 색 공간입니다. 다만, HCT 색 공간은 웹 표준이 아닐 뿐더러, 너무 자동화되어 디자이너에게 거의 통제권을 제공하지 않습니다.


이 같은 플러그인들이 있음에도 우리가 OK Palette를 만든 이유는 다음의 조건들을 모두 만족하는 플러그인이 없었기 때문입니다.

  1. OKLCH 색 공간에 기초한 토널 팔레트를 자동화하여 쉽고 빠르게 만들 수 있게 할 것.
  2. OKLCH 색 공간을 시각적으로 직접 탐색할 수 있게 함으로써 디자이너에게 거의 모든 통제권을 제공할 것.


OK Palette는 상명대학교 디자인대학 커뮤니케이션디자인전공의 손우성 교수와 최은진 학생이 개발했습니다. 우리는 여러분의 피드백을 기다리고 있습니다. 불편한 점이나 필요한 기능이 있다면 GitHub이나 이메일로 연락해 주시기 바랍니다.


주요 기능


명도에 따른 채도의 자동 조절로 팔레트 생성

OK Palette는 #000000인 완전 흑색에서 시작하여 #FFFFFF인 완전 백색에서 끝나는 토널 팔레트를 생성합니다. 사용자는 이 토널 팔레트가 지나는 중간 지점의 명도(Lightness)와 채도(Chroma)를 설정하여 다양한 토널 팔레트를 생성할 수 있습니다.


색상(Hue)의 명도 변화에 따른 조절 기능

일반적인 토널 팔레트는 시작부터 끝까지 같은 색상(Hue)을 유지하지만, 우리는 “꼭 그래야만 하나?”라고 생각했습니다. OK Palette에서는 시작 지점의 색상(Hue Start)과 끝 지점의 색상(Hue End)을 다르게 설정할 수 있는 기능도 제공합니다.


APCA 매트릭스 생성

생성된 토널 팔레트의 가능한 모든 조합에 대한 APCA 매트릭스를 자동으로 생성해줍니다.
plugins.tagline: Generates tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space

117461.name: OK Palette
117461.description:
OK Palette is a plugin that helps designers create tonal palettes for GUI design with greater control, yet in a simple and fast way. OK Palette uses OKLCH, a Perceptually Uniform Colorspace, allowing designers to easily generate tonal palettes based on Lightness, Chroma, and Hue.


Color spaces like HSB, HSL, and HSV have been widely used because of the perceived advantage of maintaining saturation and brightness while changing hues, unlike RGB. However, this is not entirely true. For instance, take HSB(60, 100, 100) in yellow and HSB(240, 100, 100) in blue. Although both have the same brightness (B) value of 100, our eyes know the truth: yellow appears brighter.


In contrast, OKLCH is a perceptually uniform color space that ensures any color with the same L value will appear at the same brightness to the human eye, regardless of hue (H). This is a crucial feature for GUI design because humans are more sensitive to differences in brightness than other attributes of color, like hue or saturation, and often rely on brightness to perceive importance.


OKLCH is already a web standard available on all browsers. Unfortunately, however, Figma does not yet offer native support for the OKLCH color space. Luckily, a few plugins enable the use of OKLCH. Notably, OkColor by DokoZero is an excellent plugin that we used before creating OK Palette, though we had to manually calculate each tonal palette (one by one). Although it does not use the OKLCH color space, Material Theme Builder by Material Design is another plugin that generates tonal palettes. It uses Google's custom HCT color space, which is also a perceptually uniform color space. However, HCT is not a web standard, and it is so automated that it provides designers with very limited control.


Despite the existence of such plugins, we created OK Palette because no existing plugin met all of the following criteria:


1. Automate the creation of tonal palettes based on the OKLCH color space for quick and easy palette generation.

2. Allow designers almost full control by enabling direct visual exploration of the OKLCH color space.


OK Palette was developed by Professor SON OO-SUNG and student Choi Eunjin from the Department of Communication Design at Sangmyung University's College of Design. We welcome your feedback. If you have any suggestions or encounter any issues, please reach out via GitHub or email.


Key Features

Palette generation with automatic saturation adjustment based on lightness

OK Palette generates a tonal palette that starts from absolute black (#000000) and ends in absolute white (#FFFFFF). Users can adjust the Lightness and Chroma values at intermediate points along the palette’s path to create a variety of tonal palettes.


Hue adjustments based on changes in lightness

Typical tonal palettes maintain the same hue from start to end, but we wondered, "Does it really have to be that way?" OK Palette offers the flexibility to set different hues at the starting point (Hue Start) and the endpoint (Hue End).


APCA matrix generation

OK Palette automatically generates an APCA matrix for all possible combinations within the tonal palette.

FigwebX is an innovative plugin that empowers users to seamlessly transform Figma designs into fully responsive WordPress and Webflow websites without any coding, all thanks to our state-of-the-art AI technology.


One of its standout features is the integrated multiple platforms. Our integration outputs include:

plugins.name: Local Variables Manipulator
plugins.description:
Local Variables Manipulator (LVM)

(Description in English)

  1. LVM is a Local Variables Exporter / Importer
  2. You can get data of Local Variables as JSON by Export.
  3. And you can update or insert Local Variables by using same format JSON.


(Description in Japanese)

  1. LVM は Local Variables の Exporter / Importer です。
  2. Local Variables の登録内容を JSON で Export できます。
  3. Export したものと同じ形式の JSON を使って Import できます。


Example JSON

{
"ColorExample": {
"Alias Token/primary": {
"$variableValues": {
"Light": "$Global Token/blue/100",
"Dark": "$Global Token/blue/100"
},
"$description": "",
"$codeSyntax": {
"WEB": "color.aliasToken.primary"
},
"$scopes": [
"ALL_SCOPES"
],
"$hiddenFromPublishing": false
},
"Global Token/blue/100": {
"$variableValues": {
"Light": "#0000FF",
"Dark": "#0000FF"
},
"$description": "",
"$codeSyntax": {
"WEB": "color.globalToken.blue['100']"
},
"$scopes": [
"ALL_SCOPES"
],
"$hiddenFromPublishing": false
}
}
}
plugins.tagline: Export / Import Local Variables

plugins.name: Skeleton Themes
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage, import, and delete themes as Figma Variables, directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator to the Skeleton Figma UI Kit. Streamline your workflow, maintain consistency, and easily customize your UI designs.


Precondition:

Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit


Guides:

  1. Set-Up Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit:
  2. Ensure you have the Skeleton v3 Figma UI Kit installed. This is essential for using the plugin, as it integrates directly with the kit’s components and styles.
  3. How to use Skeleton Themes Plugin:
  4. Import your custom themes directly from the Skeleton v3 Theme Creator.
  5. Manage and edit themes within Figma, syncing styles instantly across your projects.
  6. Delete outdated or unused themes to keep your Figma workspace organized.


Note:

Only compatible with Skeleton v3.

plugins.name: StackBlitz - design to instant dev environment in a click
plugins.description:
Implementing designs in code becomes much easier when you don't have to manually set up the environment, open and run the project, and search for the correct file. You can have all this work done for you by clicking a link!


How to use the plugin?

  • Make sure Dev Mode is on (⇧+D)
  • Select a layer
  • Open in the StackBlitz plugin and paste a URL of a repository with the code of your project. You can also use the URL of a specific file within this repository: typically, a component file, for instance: https://github.com/stackblitz/docs/blob/main/.vitepress/theme/components/CardLists/CardList.vue
  • Click the "Create instant environment link" button to have the link generated for the selected layer.


The link is now added to the layer's Dev resources.


When you click it, a new tab will open with the full IDE loaded with your project. If your link included a file, this file will already be open in the editor.


When to use it?

We suggest providing instant environment links, especially for the essential components in your app. The components that might need adjustments in future are good candidates as well.


Generally, every time a developer looks at a component in Figma to make changes in the code, having a resource link handy will make their work so much easier!

plugins.name: Tooltipo
plugins.description:
Create beautifully designed tooltips in seconds with Tooltip Generator! This plugin streamlines your workflow by offering real-time preview and comprehensive customization options. Perfect for UI designers, design system maintainers, and anyone looking to add consistent tooltips to their designs.


Detailed Features

• Live Preview: See your tooltip changes in real-time as you customize

• Multiple Positions: Choose from top, right, bottom, or left positioning

• Full Customization: Control colors, padding, font size, corner radius, and pointer size

• Color Control: Use color picker or input hex codes directly

• Auto-Layout Ready: All tooltips are created with auto-layout for easy integration

• Clean Output: Organized layers with proper naming and structure

• Dark Theme UI: Comfortable interface that matches Figma's dark theme

• Single-Click Creation: Generate your tooltip instantly with one click


How to Use

1. Set your tooltip text

2. Customize colors using the color picker or hex inputs

3. Choose the pointer position (top, right, bottom, or left)

4. Adjust size settings if needed (padding, font size, corner radius, pointer)

5. Preview your changes in real-time

6. Click "Create Tooltip" to add it to your design

plugins.name: CropTop
plugins.description:
Bring the power of CSS's background-position right into Figma with CropTop! Perfect for designers who need precise control over their image positioning within layers. Whether you're working with a single image or handling multiple selections, CropTop streamlines the process and ensures your designs look sharp.


Key Features:


🌌 CSS Familiarity: Enjoy the intuitive and familiar CSS-like method for image positioning. It's the background-position feature Figma has been missing.


🛍️ Bulk Handling: Process multiple images at once with ease, making design iterations faster and more efficient.


⚡ Quick-Fix Sidebar Shortcut: Changed the size of a layer and squished your image? No problem. With one click in the sidebar, repeat the last positioning and get it looking perfect again.

  1. Select a layer or multiple layers in your Figma design.
  2. Open the CropTop plugin.
  3. Choose your desired position anchor.
  4. Let CropTop seamlessly position and adjust your images within the layers.

plugins.name: Column Creator v2 - Auto-layout helper
plugins.description:
🌟 Introducing Column Creator v2


📊 Design Precision:

Craft pixel-perfect columns of various widths effortlessly.


🔄 Seamless Edits:

Your design evolves, and so does our plugin – automatic resizing at its best!


🎨 Easy to use:

The plugin makes use of the core features of Figma so you don't have to edit a bunch of settings inside the plugin. It's plug and play on all frames with autolayout!


💡 Unleash Your Creativity:

Our plugin empowers you to focus on what truly matters – your design vision.


🆕All new in this version:

Easily create designs with multipole widths or all of the same. Use the shortcuts for even faster changes!


How it works - Children inside

  1. Select one or more frames with autolayout enabled
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the items inside to be and click
  4. Watch your item(s) get the width of the selected amount of columns.


How it works - Selection

  1. Select one or more frames within a frame with autolayout enabled
  2. It uses the gap from the autolayout frame so no need for extra inputs
  3. Select the amount of columns you want the item(s) to be and click
  4. Watch your item(s) get the width of the selected amount of columns.


Want to buy me a coffee?

To help as many people as possible I will keep my plugins completely free. But if my plugin helped you and you want to buy me a coffee you can do that here: https://buymeacoffee.com/sven.figma
plugins.tagline: Generate super fast designs based on columns!

plugins.name: exportColorInGamut
plugins.description:
Figma/Figjam export color in correct gamut


> Note: This plugin is aimed at developers/designers working with a environment/monitor that supports a color space with a wider gamut than sRGB (specifivally p3). Figma running in a browser is limited to sRGB currently, however the desktop app supports the option to use the native OS one. You may need to enable this in the settings under: Figma > Preferences > Color Space > Unmanaged.


Motivation


When working in a wider color gamut (like the display of a modern macbook, supporting p3) and copying colors to be rendered on the web you may find them to look different (notably less saturated), to what you designed. This is to some extent an inevitable consequence of converting to a smaller color gamut (sRGB), as some colors simply cannot be represented there. There are two main strategies, each with benefits and drawbacks, to convert p3 colors to sRGB (or any larger color space to a smaller). Either you scale the colors linearly, always maintaining contrast (so two different colors in p3 will look different in sRGB), but loosing perceptual uniformity (most colors will look notably different, as a consequence of the linear mapping to a smaller color space).


The second approach is implemented in this plugin. There we ensure that a color which is in both color spaces stays perceptually uniform (looks the same), but neglect that on the extreme end of the p3 color space (regarding colors that cannot be represented in sRGB) colors are cut off. So e.g. the reddest red in p3 gets mapped to reddest red in sRGB, but so do all reds in p3 that exceed the reddes red in sRGB.


Implementation

The specific implementation outlined above is by colorjs.io.


Note that this is not the only solution for this problem. As of recently the web is no longer sRGB limited. The new CSS Color Module Level 4 specifies the color() function with which we can represent colors in wider color spaces, when supported. Hence we can use it to more directly "copy" values from figma to the css. Copy is in quotes here because there is no direct copy button in figma to do this. In essence it is a 1 to 1 mapping (of course), only in a slightly different syntax (base 1, instead of base 255). This plugin formats a string containing both approaches, first the new css color() function, then the computed mapping to sRGB. In correct order, so that the sRGB version is used as fallback, if the client browser does not support the new API. Depending on the adaption progress of the CSS Color Module Level 4 spec, you may opt to omit the sRGB version of coverage is sufficiant.


> Note that this plugin is currently only aimed displays/environment using the p3 color space, if you are on a different one (that is supported by colorjs.io, please write me / submit a issue and I will try to make it more modular)


Usage


Select any element, and run the plugin. A string like the following will be copied to your clipboard:


background: rgb(71.942% 0% 5.7326%);
background: color(display-p3 0.6583 0.1125 0.1125);


Limitations


Gradient fills and opacity are not supported yet. If you need them, please write me / submit an issue and I will try to add this feature.


This plugin is intentionally only concerned with filled colors (text, strokes, background...) editable in figma. If you want to export an asset in the correct color space, please refer to Export PNG with Color Profile.

accepted.name: Maximilian Mairinger
accepted.description: Web advocate, passionate about Typescript, image compression, UI design and emergency medicine. Currently, studying AI at JKU.

plugins.tagline: Export colors in wider color space with wider gamut (p3). With properly interpolated sRGB fallback.

plugins.name: Dual Font Master
plugins.description:
New Release: "Dual Font Master" Figma Plugin


💪 What the Plugin Can Do

  1. Register text styles for English and Japanese to apply to your designs.
  2. Apply these registered text styles to your design data.
  3. When registering text styles, set the font weight to 'Auto' to carry over the original font weight.
  4. Instantly preview chosen styles to see exactly how they will look in your design.


🚨 Points to Note

  1. When setting the font weight to "Auto", please make sure that the font weight before modification is also present in the modified text. If no corresponding font family is found for the modified font, the font weight "Regular" will be set automatically.
  2. The plugin cannot process text nodes where font family or font weight attributes are set to 'mixed'.


🎬 Use Cases

Ideal for global digital products, multilingual marketing materials, and UI/UX design of websites. It maintains font consistency while enabling smooth language transitions, streamlining the design process.


📋 License

💪 プラグインができること

  1. デザインに適用する英語と日本語のテキストスタイルを登録できます
  2. 登録したテキストスタイルを、デザインデータに適用します
  3. テキストスタイル登録時、フォントウェイトを「Auto」で設定することにより、修正前のフォントウェイトを引き継ぐことができます。
  4. サンプルプレビューにて、選択したスタイルが実際にどのように見えるかを即座に確認可能です。


🚨 ご留意いただきたい点

  1. フォントウェイトを「Auto」で設定する場合、修正前のフォントウェイトが、修正後のテキストにもあることをご確認ください。もし修正後のフォントに対応するフォントファミリーが見つからない場合、フォントウェイト「Regular」が自動的に設定されます。
  2. テキストノード内でフォントファミリーやフォントウェイトの属性が 'mixed' とされている場合、プラグインは処理を行うことができません。

83273.name: Dual Font Master
83273.description:
New Release: "Dual Font Master" Figma Plugin


💪 What the Plugin Can Do

  1. Register text styles for English and Japanese to apply to your designs.
  2. Apply these registered text styles to your design data.
  3. When registering text styles, set the font weight to 'Auto' to carry over the original font weight.
  4. Instantly preview chosen styles to see exactly how they will look in your design.


🚨 Points to Note

  1. When setting the font weight to "Auto", please make sure that the font weight before modification is also present in the modified text. If no corresponding font family is found for the modified font, the font weight "Regular" will be set automatically.
  2. The plugin cannot process text nodes where font family or font weight attributes are set to 'mixed'.


🎬 Use Cases

Ideal for global digital products, multilingual marketing materials, and UI/UX design of websites. It maintains font consistency while enabling smooth language transitions, streamlining the design process.

plugins.name: AI Icon Finder
plugins.description:
AI Icon Finder is a powerful Figma plugin that helps designers quickly find the perfect icons using natural language. Simply describe what you're looking for, and our AI will interpret your query and locate the most relevant icons instantly.


How It Works


  1. Type a description of the icon you need (e.g., "payment confirmation" or "shopping cart with items")
  2. Click "Search" and watch as AI interprets your query into relevant keywords
  3. AI Interpreted queries are clickable and using as a search element for better linking over results
  4. Browse the results and preview icons before inserting
  5. Insert directly into your design or copy the SVG with one click
plugins.tagline: AI-powered icon search that understands even the most abstract prompts.

plugins.name: Copy Paste Styled Text
plugins.description:
Copying text into Figma shouldn’t mean losing your formatting.


🌎 Problem We Solve —

When you directly copy and paste text from the web into Figma, it usually loses its structure—everything gets flattened into a single, unformatted block of text.


🚀 Our Solution —

With this plugin, your text stays formatted exactly as it should—headings, bullet points, code styling, you name it—it all remains intact. No more reformatting by hand. Our plugin seamlessly handles styles for:

  1. headings
  2. subheadings
  3. bullet points & lists
  4. code snippets
  5. font weights
  6. bold & italics


🌱 Get the most out of this plugin with ChatGPT —

This also works seamlessly with text documents generated in ChatGPT, Claude, DeepSeek, Gemini, Mistral, Llama, or your favorite LLM of choice.

Whether you're drafting a quick project scope outline or developer handoff notes, simply copy and paste it from your LLM into Figma using this plugin, and your structured document will remain perfectly intact—ready to use without extra formatting effort.


P.S. If you found this plugin useful, check out more of our free resources on our Bento. For updates on new releases, follow @redwood.ux on Instagram!


🍊 Find us online!

  1. Instagram: @redwood.ux
  2. Website: redwoodux.com
  3. Kofi: ko-fi.com/redwoodux
  4. Bento: bento.me/redwoodux
plugins.tagline: Preserve your text formatting when you copy-paste text from the web into Figma
